content: pumpkin pattern by kit fox projects intro a cute little pumpkin gauge 8 sts x 6 row = 2 level beginner measurements this pattern is adjustable have fun with it use different yarns adjust the size have fun abbreviations bl = back loop magic_ring = magic_ring rs = right side chain = chain half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet repeat = repeat single_crochet = single_crochet st = stitch sts = stitches decrease = together materials other poly-fill or some other stuffing yarns big twist carousel medium lion brand heartland medium hooks us7/4 5mm tools darning needle page 1 of 4 pumpkin pumpkin body ℹyou may need to use a larger hook for starting chain and the turning chain 2 doesn t count as a stitch leave a 16in/41cm tail at start 1 chain 27 half_double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook half_double_crochet across chain 2 and turn it should be about 6in/15cm 2 half_double_crochet across chain 2 and turn 3 half_double_crochet in back loop across chain 2 turn 4 repeat row 2 5 repeat row 2 6 repeat row 2 7 repeat row 3 8 repeat row 4-7 till about 12in /30cm in length ℹbo with a very long tail i used my arm span ℹusing the 16in/41cm starting tail seam the short sides of the rectangle together with the rs facing out you should now have a cylinder after weaving in my end i left my tail on the inside to add to the stuffing ℹturn the cylinder inside out using the long tail sew a running stitch along the edge of the cylinder ℹcarefully pull the running stitch tight so the end of the cylinder bunches closed then sew any remaining gap closed and tie a knot do not cut off the tail ℹfrom here on it can be tricky to get it just right it s important to make it your own ℹturn the cylinder rs out and flatten the bottom closed end a bit using the long tail sew through the edge of the top of the cylinder ℹfill as even as you can with poly-fill but don t over fill it should be squishy but filled enough to be plump i used my fingers to stretch out the middle with the stuffing to round it out ℹwith the long tail sew a running stitch along the top of the cylinder if you need to add more stuffing this is the last chance page 2 of 4 slowly pull the tail and shape the pumpkin by tucking the edge in you may have to push the fabric around to get the top to close all the way sew any gap left closed ℹthen sew the end all the way through the top of the pumpkin to the bottom to pull the centers in you can knot it on the bottom if that helps it hold the shape do not cut tail yet i also marked the top of the pumpkin but you don t have to ℹusing the tail we
